page.title: 16LANGUAGE IAITH
page.content: The predominant language of the area is Welsh, though in recent years more English speaking people have moved to the area. All children of primary school age are taught Welsh and the subject,like maths and English,is compulsary in the first 5 years of secondary school.In a survey in May 1985 6.3% of the pupils in the first few years at secondary school considered themselves learners of Welsh,the remainder spoke Welsh as a first language or were fluent in it as a second language. All children have the choice of doing their school work in either English or Welsh.Of the 92 children in the 1st form at Ysgol Botwnnog 11 chose to do their written work in English. Welsh is used not only in the school but in everyday life,chapel,church,wo- rk,commerce and in daily conversation.
